title: Defend your planet
summary: With so many asteroids out there, it’s up to us to defend our planet from impacts. Find out how you can make a difference.

title: LightSail 2 getting lower as it completes third year in space
summary: An update on The Planetary Society's LightSail 2 mission, which launched in 2015.

title: RocketStars: Ly brings together requirements for USSF-12 launch
summary: Shepherding the requirements to deliver two innovative national security satellites into orbit aboard the same Atlas V rocket is the responsibility of Anna Ly, United Launch Alliance (ULA) mission integration systems engineer (MISE) for the United St...

title: How do planets get rings?
summary: The planets in our Solar System show that no two ring systems are exactly alike.

title: Updates from our Shoemaker NEO Grant winners
summary: Brief updates on what the latest Shoemaker NEO grant winners have been working on.

title: Persevering through it all
summary: Exploration will always face setbacks, but this week’s Downlink reminds us of the impressive human ability to persevere.

title: A joint-letter in support of NEO Surveyor
summary: The National Space Society and The Planetary Society jointly argue for funding the asteroid-hunting NEO Surveyor mission.

title: USSF-12: Atlas V receives two SSC satellite payloads
summary: The United States Space Force (USSF)-12 dual-manifested payloads are in final preparations to launch into geosynchronous orbit following today's successful stacking atop their United Launch Alliance (ULA) Atlas V 541 rocket.

title: Why can't the ISS operate forever?
summary: Here are the reasons the International Space Station (ISS) needs to deorbit eventually.

title: First steps and big leaps
summary: Technological innovation is a big part of the fun of space exploration, and you can help make it happen.
